greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime with exactly n consecutive zeros in the longest run of zeros in its binary expansion.
comment: Except for 2, the first and last binary digits of a prime number are 1.

One may also define a sequence of the smallest prime with its longest run of zeros containing *at least* n zeros in the binary expansion: 2, 2, 17, 17, 67, 131, 257, 257, 2053, 4099,.... - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 09 2013
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3313
mathematica: a = Table[0, {30}]; NextPrim[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[ ! PrimeQ[k], k++ ]; k]; p = 2; Do[ m = Length[ Union[ DeleteCases[ Split[ IntegerDigits[p, 2]], 1, 2]][[ -1]]]; If[ a[[m + 1]] == 0, a[[m + 1]] = p]; p = NextPrim[p], {n, 1, 117000000}]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 03 2003
